revised_title: Friction and Lubrication Mechanisms in Polymers
tldr: The authors studied the friction and lubrication of polymers, specifically nylon and polyethylene, and found that the friction of unlubricated surfaces can be explained by adhesion and deformation mechanisms. They also investigated the effects of water and other lubricants on the friction and lubrication of polymers, providing insights into the role of surface films and the interaction between polymers and various substances.
